sen.j: 宇多野駅（うたのえき）は、京都市右京区宇多野長尾町にある京福電気鉄道京福電気鉄道北野線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Utano Station is a railway station of the Kitano Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad in Nagao-cho, Utano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Utano Station is a railway facility of the Kitano Line, Keifuku Electric Railroad in Nagao-cho, Utano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Utano Station, located in Nagao-cho, Utano, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a railway facility of the Kitano Line, which is operated by Keifuku Electric Railroad.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 駅ナンバリングはB4。
sen.e: Station number B4.
Its station number is B4.
Its station number is B4.

sen.j: 2007年3月18日までの駅名は「高雄口駅」（たかおぐちえき）。
sen.e: Until March 18, 2007, the station was named "Takaoguchi station".
Prior to March 18, 2007, it was called Takaoguchi Station.
Prior to March 18, 2007, it was called Takaoguchi Station.

sen.j: かつての駅名標には、歴史的仮名遣に則り平仮名で「たかをぐち」と表記されていたのが特徴。
sen.e: Formerly the station's name was notable as it conformed with pre-war Japanese hiragana spelling conventions by being written as "Takawoguchi".
Formerly, the station's name was notable as it conformed with the conventions of pre-war Japanese hiragana spelling by being written as "Takawoguchi."
Formerly, the station's name was notable as it conformed with the conventions of pre-war Japanese hiragana spelling by being written as 'Takawoguchi.'

sen.j: ちなみにローマ字表記は「TAKAOGUCHI」となっているが、近隣にある一部の観光案内図には「TAKAWOGUCHI」と表記されているものもあった。
sen.e: As an aside, the anglicized spelling ended up being "TAKAOGUCHI" but, there were tourist guide maps in the vicinity that listed the name as "TAKAWOGUCHI".
As an aside, the anglicized spelling ended up being "TAKAOGUCHI," but there were tourist guide maps in the vicinity that listed the name as "TAKAWOGUCHI."
As an aside, the anglicized spelling ended up being 'TAKAOGUCHI,' but there were some tourist guide maps in the vicinity that listed the name as 'TAKAWOGUCHI.'

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 千鳥式2面1線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: The station is above ground and has two double sided platforms servicing 1 line.
The station is above ground and has two double-sided platforms serving one line.
The station is above ground and has two platforms in staggered array serving one line.
sen.cmt: 千鳥式ホーム→platforms in staggered array としました。

sen.j: 帷子ノ辻方面行きホームには東側のみに1ヶ所、北野白梅町方面行きホームには2ヶ所に出入り口がある。
sen.e: There is only a single entrance/exit on the eastern side of the platform sited towards Katabiranotsuji. The platform sited towards Kitano-Hakubaicho Station has entrance/exits in 2 locations.
There is only a single entrance/exit on the eastern side of the platform sited toward Katabiranotsuji. The platform sited toward Kitano-Hakubaicho Station has entrance/exits in two locations.
There is only a single entrance/exit on the eastern side of the platform bound for Katabiranotsuji, and the platform bound for Kitano-Hakubaicho has entrances/exits in two locations.

sen.j: 北野白梅町方面行きホームの向かい側に、かつて行き違い設備があったことを偲ばせる苔むしたホーム跡がある。
sen.e: Opposite to the platform pointing towards Kitano-Hakubaicho Station there are the moss covered remains of a previous structure pointing in a different direction.
Opposite the platform pointing toward Kitano-Hakubaicho Station, there are the moss-covered remains of a previous structure pointing in a different direction.
Opposite the platform bound for Kitano-Hakubaicho, there is moss-covered remains of a platform that once served as a facility where inbound and outbound trains could pass one another.

sen.j: 戦後は長らく北側ホームのみであったが、1982年の車両のワンマン式化に際し、現在の帷子ノ辻行きホームが新たに後付けで設けられた。
sen.e: For a long time after the war there was only one platform on the northern side but, with the advent of trains being operated solely by a driver in 1982, the platform pointing towards Katabiranotsuji was newly added.

For a long time after the war, there was only one platform on the northern side, but with the advent of trains being operated solely by a driver in 1982, the platform pointing toward Katabiranotsuji was added.

For a long time after the war, there was only one platform on the northern side, but with the advent of trains being operated solely by a driver in 1982, the platform pointing toward Katabiranotsuji was added.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 鳴滝～宇多野間の「桜のトンネル」
sen.e: "Sakura (Cherry Blossom) Tunnel" between Narutaki and Utano Stations
The "Sakura (Cherry Blossom) Tunnel" between Narutaki and Utano stations
The Cherry Tunnel between Narutaki and Utano
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: - 春の桜開花シーズンにに夜間ライトアップされる。
sen.e: - Lit-up at night during the spring cherry blossom season.
Lit up at night during the spring cherry blossom season
The tunnel is illuminated at night during the cherry-blossom season in spring.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 画像は、京福電気鉄道北野線桜のトンネルを参照。
sen.e: The image shows the Sakura Tunnel along the Kitano line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
The image shows the Sakura Tunnel along the Kitano Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
For photos of the tunnel, see the article on the Cherry Tunnel of the Kitano Line of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 京都市立宇多野小学校
sen.e: Utano Elementary School, Kyoto City
Utano Elementary School, Kyoto City
Kyoto Municipal Utano Elementary School
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 嵯峨野病院

Sagano Hospital
Sagano Hospital

sen.j: 聖イエス会本部、嵯峨野教会

Sagano Church, headquarters of the Congregation of Jesus

sen.j: 京都宇多野郵便局
sen.e: Kyoto Utano Post Office
The Kyoto Utano post office
The Kyoto Utano post office

sen.j: 福王子神社
sen.e: Fukuoji-jinja Shrine
Fukuoji-jinja Shrine

sen.j: その他、寺院多数。
sen.e: Other, many shrines and temples
Numerous other shrines and temples
Numerous other shrines and temples

sen.j: 1925年（大正14年）11月3日 京都電燈による北野～高雄口間の開業時に高雄口駅として開業。
sen.e: On November 3, 1925, Kyoto Dento (Electric Light) opened Takaoguchi Station for business when the section between Kitano ～ Takaoguchi opened.
On November 3, 1925, Kyoto Dento (Electric Light) opened Takaoguchi Station for business when the section between Kitano and Takaoguchi opened.
November 3, 1925: Kyoto Dento (an electric power company) opened Takaoguchi Station for business when the section between Kitano and Takaoguchi opened.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年）3月10日 高雄口～帷子ノ辻間が開業。
sen.e: On March 10, 1926, the section between Takaoguchi ～ Katabiranotsuji opened.
On March 10, 1926, the section between Takaoguchi and Katabiranotsuji opened.
March 10, 1926: The section between Takaoguchi and Katabiranotsuji opened.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.j: 嵐山本線と繋がる。
sen.e: Linked with the Arashiyama Main Line.
It was linked with the Arashiyama Main Line.
It was linked with the Arashiyama Main Line.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 路線継承により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: On March 2, 1942, the route was taken over and became a Keifuku Electric Railroad station.
On March 2, 1942, the route was taken over and the facility became a station of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
March 2, 1942: The line was taken over and the facility became a station of the Keifuku Electric Railroad.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に統一しました。

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）3月19日 宇多野駅に改称。
sen.e: On March 19, 2007 renamed as Utano Station.
On March 19, 2007, it was renamed as Utano Station.
March 19, 2007: It was renamed as Utano Station.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に統一しました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: テレビ朝日系で放送中の土曜ワイド劇場「京都殺人案内」には、劇中で音川刑事の自宅の最寄駅という設定で登場し、ロケが行われる事がある。
sen.e: In the Saturday Playhouse drama "Kyoto Murder Guide" broadcast by TV Asahi, the program sets the station as the neighborhood station for detective Otokawa's home and, a location where action takes place.

In the Saturday Playhouse drama "Kyoto Murder Guide" broadcast by TV Asahi, the program sets the facility as the neighborhood station for detective Otokawa's home, as well as a location where action takes place.

In the Saturday Playhouse drama 'Kyoto Murder Guide' broadcast by TV Asahi, the program sets the facility as the neighborhood station for detective Otokawa's home, as well as a location where action takes place.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。
